meanings.definition: In a manner relating to the breakdown of complex molecules into simpler ones for energy production.
meanings.sent1: She ran catabolically to generate energy for her workout.
meanings.sent2: The body catabolically breaks down food to extract energy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel catabolically devoured the acorn in record time.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered catabolically, slowly losing power.
meanings.sent5: The fire burned catabolically, consuming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves the metabolic process of breaking down substances for energy.
meanings.sent1: He worked catabolically to process the food efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The cells catabolically convert nutrients into usable energy.
meanings.sent3: The robot catabolically dismantled the old electronics for parts.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed catabolically, eroding the rocks over time.
meanings.sent5: The factory hummed catabolically, transforming raw materials into products.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the chemical reactions that release energy by breaking down complex molecules.
meanings.sent1: The catabolic process is essential for energy production.
meanings.sent2: The catabolic reaction releases energy from the molecules.
meanings.sent3: The catabolic nature of the engine made it fuel-efficient.
meanings.sent4: The catabolic breakdown of the structure revealed its flaws.
meanings.sent5: The catabolic power plant supplied electricity to the city.
